main event: One unidentified flying object was observed in Eastman, Georgia on April 9, 1966.
interesting points: The object traveled at a straight path to the south at the same altitude during level flight., The sighting lasted between 5 to 10 seconds., The observer described the object as round and very bright, similar in size and color to the brighter stars in the Little Dipper., The observer believed the object was moving much faster and was much higher than an aircraft., The local weatherman suggested it could have been a satellite, but the observer disagreed due to the object's unusual trajectory.
witness description: Mr. JR., age 41, president of an oil distributor firm
